dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh, thank you for stopping! Everyone acts like nothing's wrong. Like my little boy isn't at risk of being eaten by some vile creature!

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Please, you have to help me get my little Tucker back! He ran away and is going to get himself killed! Oh, I just know a raptidon is melting him with acid as we speak!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Your child is missing? Where'd you last see him?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Calm down. Take a deep breath, then tell me what happened.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Not my problem.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh, I just knew you were a good person. 'Agnes,' I said, 'this is the man to save your little Tuckie!' And I was right!

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: He ran out into the wilderness a few days ago. I warned him about the raptidons, mantisaurs, and marauders - the toxic sulfur pools, and poisonous plants. But he didn't listen!

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Please! Won't you go and find my boy?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll help you find your son.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Did you say there was a reward involved with this request?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why would Tucker run away?

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Thank you! Oh, I know he'll be safe now that someone's able to fetch him home.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: You look for him in Amber Heights, you hear? It's down the road southwest of town. I'm sure he made it that far, I just know it.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: And if you find any of them Iconoclasts indoctrinating my boy, you punch them in the mouths! Tell them what I think of them luring little boys away from their mamas. It's immoral!

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well, I... I guess I can't ask you to leave the town walls for free. It is deathly dangerous out there.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: I've got some bits saved up for a rainy day. I'll give you every last one if you just bring my Tucker back to me. I won't even be mad at him running off. You tell him, I won't be mad.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: He's been pining for an adventure, says he's tired of living cooped up behind the walls. But he doesn't understand how dangerous it is out there.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: I warned him. A raptidon would snap him up first chance it got. I just know one's ripped his arm off and is gnawing on his sweet little fingers!

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: He should've listened to his mama. I promised I'd keep him safe here with me.

dialog.speaker: Agnes_Needham (Female)
dialog.utterance: Don't you tell me to calm down! I promised my boy I'd protect him for always. But how can I keep him safe if he's run away?
